citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
A bees nest is present, outside of the owl monkey's indoor enclosure. According to staff, the bees were found to be able
to enter the indoor enclosure through the building. This bees nest must be removed in order to protect the health and well-
being of the monkey housed there-in. The monkey has been housed in a different area to protect it from injury.
However, an effective program for control of insects, external parasites affecting nonhuman primates, must be established
and maintained so as to promote the health and well-being of the animals and reduce contamination by pests in animal
areas.

* The wood trim, that runs across the front of the soffit of the leopard enclosure viewing window, has been water logged
and is now rotted. This deterioration leaves the soffit in disrepair. The damaged soffit should be repaired so that it
facilitates the prescribed husbandry practices.
* There is an overgrowth of bamboo inside of the fishing cat enclosure. The bamboo provides a natural environment as
well as areas of security for the fishing cats housed there-in. The leaf growth of the bamboo has gone through and above
the top, wire mesh of the enclosure. The overgrowth at the top could weaken and damage the top wire mesh. The
bamboo should be trimmed to thin out the overgrowth and to prevent damage to the top wire mesh.
Premises (buildings and grounds) shall be kept clean and in good repair in order to protect the animals from injury and to
facilitate the prescribed husbandry practices set forth in this subpart.
This inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the curator.
Additional Inspectors:
JESSICA GOWINS, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
3.84(d)  Repeat
   
Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control. 
A bees nest is present, outside of the owl monkey's indoor enclosure. According to staff, the bees were found to be able 
to enter the indoor enclosure through the building. This bees nest must be removed in order to protect the health and well-
being of the monkey housed there-in. The monkey has been housed in a different area to protect it from injury.  
 
However, an effective program for control of insects, external parasites affecting nonhuman primates, must be established 
and maintained so as to promote the health and well-being of the animals and reduce contamination by pests in animal 
areas. 
3.131(c)  Repeat
   
Sanitation. 
* The wood trim, that runs across the front of the soffit of the leopard enclosure viewing window, has been water logged 
and is now rotted. This deterioration leaves the soffit in disrepair. The damaged soffit should be repaired so that it 
facilitates the prescribed husbandry practices. 
 
* There is an overgrowth of bamboo inside of the fishing cat enclosure. The bamboo provides a natural environment as 
well as areas of security for the fishing cats housed there-in. The leaf growth of the bamboo has gone through and above 
the top, wire mesh of the enclosure. The overgrowth at the top could weaken and damage the top wire mesh. The 
bamboo should be trimmed to thin out the overgrowth and to prevent damage to the top wire mesh. 
 
Premises (buildings and grounds) shall be kept clean and in good repair in order to protect the animals from injury and to 
facilitate the prescribed husbandry practices set forth in this subpart. 
 
This inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the curator.

Additional Inspectors: 
JESSICA GOWINS, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

species.common: DOMESTIC PIG / POTBELLY PIG / MICRO PIG
